FuncDef:
The access leased-line connection chasten quickoffline command enables suppression of leased line user access.
The undo access leased-line connection chasten command disables suppression of leased line user access.
By default, suppression of leased line user access is disabled.
CLIs: undo access leased-line connection chasten [ <request-session> <request-period> <blocking-period> quickoffline ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the maximum number of connection requests allowed.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 10000.

Specifies an interval at which connection requests can be sent.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 3600, in seconds.

Specifies a blocking period for connection requests.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 3600, in seconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If the duration or traffic volume quota delivered by the RADIUS server to a leased line user is 0, the leased line user can go online but will go offline immediately. This results in frequent login and logout of leased line users.
To prevent this problem, run the access leased-line connection chasten command to
configure the maximum number of connection requests allowed, the interval at which connection requests can be sent, and a blocking period. After the leased line user has attempted the maximum number of connection requests allowed, the user's connection requests will be blocked.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
